But they also see the collective advantages, as for example a relatively good and direct communication between intellectuals and leaders of different languages through the English language, and the personal advantages as their own knowledge of the English language. About a neutral language such as Esperanto, one does not know much and does not seek information.

japanese: トムはもう食べた。
english: Tom has already eaten.

japanese: トムはもう食べてしまった。
english: Tom has already eaten.

japanese: トムはもう食べてしまっている。
english: Tom has already eaten.

japanese: トムは馬刺しを食べたことがない。
english: Tom has never eaten raw horse meat.

japanese: 事故以来トムは固形物を食べられずにいる。
english: Tom hasn't been able to eat solid food since his accident.

japanese: トムはこういうチーズ、食べないかも。
english: Tom might not eat this kind of cheese.

japanese: トムは、こんなにおいしいご飯は食べたことがない、と言った。
english: Tom said that he'd never eaten such a delicious meal before.

japanese: トムは、こんなにおいしいご飯はこれが初めてだ、と言った。
english: Tom said that he'd never eaten such a delicious meal before.

japanese: トムはめったに魚介類を食べない。
english: Tom seldom eats seafood.

japanese: トムは以前はジャンクフードをたくさん食べていた。
english: Tom used to eat a lot of junk food.

japanese: 電話が鳴ったとき、トムはデザートを食べていた。
english: Tom was eating his dessert when the phone rang.

japanese: トムはザクロの食べ方をYouTubeの動画で見た。
english: Tom watched a YouTube video on how to eat a pomegranate.

japanese: 間食はしない方がいいよ。
english: You shouldn't eat between meals.

japanese: 種類に富んだ新鮮な果物と野菜を食べるべきです。
english: You should eat a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables.

japanese: パンケーキを食べるとき、たいてい何枚くらい食べますか。
english: When you eat pancakes, how many do you usually eat?

japanese: 旅行で食べたもので一番興味深かったものは何ですか。
english: What's the most interesting thing you ate on your trip?

japanese: ここね、町でもトップクラスの美味しいお店なんだ。
english: This is one of the best places to eat in town.

japanese: 図書館の前の木の下で、お昼ごはんを食べている男性が何人かいました。
english: There were some men eating their lunches under the trees in front of the library.

japanese: 前回あのレストランで食事をした時、食べ物はあまりおいしくなかった。
english: The last time I ate at that restaurant the food wasn't very good.

japanese: コーチは選手たちに試合前は食べ過ぎないようにと伝えた。
english: The coach told the players not to eat too much before the game.

japanese: 毎食グレープフルーツを食べれば体重が減ると思っている人もいる。
english: Some people think that eating grapefruit with every meal will help you lose weight.

japanese: 雨が降っていたので、私たちはピクニック用のお弁当を室内で食べなければいけなかった。
english: Since it was raining, we had to eat our picnic lunch indoors.

japanese: 誰も食べたくなかった。
english: No one wanted to eat.

japanese: 子供たちは私が家に帰るまでにクッキーを全部食べてしまっていた。
english: My children had eaten all the cookies by the time I got home.

japanese: 大半の人がバランスのとれた食事を取っていない。
english: Most of us don't eat a balanced diet.

japanese: 食べましょう。
english: Let's eat.

japanese: 食べようよ。
english: Let's eat.

japanese: 外でランチを食べましょう。
english: Let's eat lunch outside.

japanese: 外でお昼ご飯を食べましょう。
english: Let's eat lunch outside.

japanese: あなたとあのレストランで食事ができたらよかったのに。
english: I wish I could've eaten at that restaurant with you.

japanese: 私は普段、昼食をたっぷり取る時間がない。
english: I usually don't have time to eat a large lunch.

japanese: あんなに食べるんじゃなかった。
english: I shouldn't have eaten so much.

japanese: あんなに食べなきゃよかった。
english: I shouldn't have eaten so much.

japanese: コーシャしか食べません。
english: I only eat kosher food.

japanese: コーシャ料理しか口にしません。
english: I only eat kosher food.

japanese: コーシャフードしか食べませんよ。
english: I only eat kosher food.

japanese: コーシャ食品しか食べないんだ。
english: I only eat kosher food.

japanese: 玄関の呼び鈴が鳴った時、私はちょうど昼食を食べ終えたところでした。
english: I had just finished eating lunch when my doorbell rang.

japanese: あなたと一緒に食事をするのは楽しい。
english: I enjoy eating with you.

japanese: これを食べたくない。
english: I don't want to eat this.

japanese: これを食べたくありません。
english: I don't want to eat this.

japanese: 何も食べたくないんです。
english: I don't want to eat anything.

japanese: 揚げ物はめったに食べません。
english: I don't often eat deep-fried food.

japanese: ピーマンは全く食べない。
english: I don't eat green peppers at all.

japanese: 昨日、ランチは食べなかったよ。
english: I didn't eat lunch yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、昼ご飯を食べなかったんだ。
english: I didn't eat lunch yesterday.

japanese: 今朝は朝食抜きでした。
english: I didn't eat breakfast this morning.

japanese: 先週は毎日ピザを食べてたよ。
english: I ate pizza every day last week.

japanese: ケーキ、どれだけ食べれる？
english: How much cake can you eat?

japanese: 馬は草を食べる。
english: Horses eat grass.

japanese: 青年の顔は、一層あからんだ。
english: The young man's face became even redder.

japanese: 母は、長女が芝居の研究会にはいっていることは知っていたが、まさか舞台に出るまで深入りしているとは、知らなかった。
english: Her mother knew that her eldest daughter had signed up for a drama seminar, but she had no idea that she was so deeply involved as to appear on stage.

japanese: 外人達のテニスのトーナメントがありますよ。見にいらっしゃいませんか。
english: The foreigners are having a tennis tournament. Do you want to go?

japanese: 小太郎が、大きい揚羽の蝶を見つけて、草原の中へ十間ばかり追いかけて行った。
english: Kotaro found a large swallowtail butterfly and chased him about 20 meters inside the grass field.

japanese: 全くもって意味不明だな。
english: It makes no sense at all.

japanese: 今それをやっているところだ。
english: I'm working on it.

japanese: 彼女、乳がんなのよ。
english: She has breast cancer.

japanese: これ、触ってもいい？
english: Can I touch it?

japanese: 触ってもいいですか？
english: Can I touch it?

japanese: 彼女は笑い、私をいたずらっぽく小突いた。
english: She laughed and gave me a playful shove.

japanese: 彼女は何をたくらんでいるのだろう？
english: What is she up to?

japanese: この猫、何をしようとしているんだろう？
english: What is the cat up to?

japanese: ヒントをありがとう。
english: Thanks for the hint.

japanese: 問題は、太陽光エネルギーはお金がかかりすぎることです。
english: The problem is that solar energy just costs too much.

japanese: マユコは寝不足です。
english: Mayuko doesn't get enough sleep.

japanese: 誕生日プレゼント何が欲しい？
english: What do you want for your birthday?

japanese: 誕生日に何が欲しい？
english: What do you want for your birthday?

japanese: 彼の名前がトムではないことをなぜ知っていたのですか。
english: How did you know his name wasn't Tom?

japanese: トムはどうやってメアリーと知り合ったの？
english: How did Tom get to know Mary?

japanese: これはどのように発音するんですか？
english: How do you pronounce this?

japanese: 信号は赤だったのに、あの車が突っ込んできたんです。
english: Even though the light was red, that car just drove right through.

japanese: 花の水やりは、お父さんがします。
english: My father waters the flowers.

japanese: お父さんが、花に水をやります。
english: My father waters the flowers.

japanese: 彼は本を机に置いていった。
english: He put the book on the desk.

japanese: 泥棒なんかじゃありません。
english: I'm not a thief.

japanese: 泥棒じゃないよ。
english: I'm not a thief.

japanese: 深刻な悩みがあるの。
english: I have a serious problem.

japanese: ご忠告ありがとう。
english: Thanks for the advice.

japanese: アドバイス、ありがとう。
english: Thanks for the advice.

japanese: 近所におもちゃ屋があります。
english: There is a toy shop in the neighborhood.

japanese: 彼らには、どこか似たところがある。
english: They look similar in some ways.

japanese: この映画はずいぶん昔に観ました。
english: I saw this movie a very long time ago.

japanese: 男が女のために車のドアを開ける場合は、女か車かのどちらかが新しい。
english: When a man opens the door of a car for a woman, either the woman is new, or the car.

japanese: 男が女のために車のドアを開けるのは、女が新しいか、車が新しいかのどちらかだ。
english: When a man opens the door of a car for a woman, either the woman is new, or the car.

japanese: あいつは車の中で生活してるんだ。
english: He lives in his car.

japanese: このことはなかったことにしよう。
english: Let's pretend this never happened.

japanese: 無茶なことするなよ。
english: Don't do anything stupid.

japanese: 無茶なことをするな。
english: Don't do anything stupid.

japanese: 馬鹿なことをしないでください。
english: Don't do anything stupid.

japanese: 多分そんなに時間はかからないだろうとトムが言った。
english: Tom said that it probably wouldn't take too much time.

japanese: メアリーに会う以前、トムはプロのギャンブラーだった。
english: Tom was a professional gambler before he met Mary.

japanese: 今週はスケジュールがぎちぎちに詰まってるんだ。
english: I'm on a really tight schedule this week.

japanese: 私たちと一緒に来て下さるのならうれしいのですが。
english: I'd be delighted if you could come with us.

japanese: 喜んで歌わせていただきます。
english: I'd be delighted to sing for you.

japanese: スピーチをお願いされた時には、喜んでやらせていただきます。
english: I'd be delighted if they asked me to give a speech.

japanese: チームを辞めるように言われたら、落ち込んでしまうよ。
english: I'd be depressed if they asked me to quit the team.

japanese: 私たちと一緒に夕食を取っていただけたら最高なのですが。
english: It would be great if you could join us for dinner.

japanese: 母がミシンをくれた。
english: My mother gave me a sewing machine.

japanese: コーヒーでも飲め。
english: Have some coffee.

japanese: ひょっとしてオレに惚れちゃった？
english: Are you falling in love with me?

japanese: 終わった？
english: Are you finished?

japanese: 終わったの？
english: Are you finished?

japanese: 誰かと一緒なの？
english: Are you with someone?

japanese: トムに聞いたの？
english: Did you ask Tom?

japanese: トムに尋ねましたか。
english: Did you ask Tom?

japanese: トムの家に入ったことはありますか？
english: Have you ever been inside Tom's house?

japanese: 急がないと遅れちゃうよ。
english: Hurry up or you'll be late.

japanese: そんなこと言ってないよ。
english: I didn't say that.

japanese: これね、私のだと思うんだ。
english: I think this is mine.

japanese: 気をつけます。
english: I'll be careful.

japanese: もう一回チャンスをあげよう。
english: I'm going to give you one more chance.

japanese: 腹減ったな。
english: I'm hungry.

japanese: おなかペコペコ。
english: I'm hungry.

japanese: トムのことが心配なの。
english: I'm worried about Tom.

japanese: どうもありがとうございました。
english: Thank you very much.

japanese: どうもありがとうございます。
english: Thank you very much.

japanese: そりゃいいね。
english: That sounds great.

japanese: トムは職場で大変な一日を過ごした。
english: Tom had a rough day at work.

japanese: トムはとても記憶力がいい。
english: Tom has a pretty good memory.

japanese: トムはシャツをズボンの中に入れた。
english: Tom tucked his shirt into his pants.

japanese: トムは2・3日で息を引き取るだろう。
english: Tom will be dead in a few days.

japanese: そこにいたの？
english: Were you there?

japanese: 何飲んでるの？
english: What are you drinking?

japanese: トムはどう思う？
english: What do you think, Tom?

japanese: これの何が悪いの？
english: What's wrong with this?

japanese: それどこで聞いたの？
english: Where did you hear that?

japanese: それはどちらでお聞きになったのですか？
english: Where did you hear that?

japanese: どこでその話を聞いたの？
english: Where did you hear that?

japanese: 私が買ってあげたシャツはどこ？
english: Where's the shirt I bought you?

japanese: 誰と行くんですか？
english: Who are you going with?

japanese: これ誰にもらったの？
english: Who gave you this?

japanese: これ誰にもらったんですか？
english: Who gave you this?

japanese: コメントありがとうございます。
english: Thanks for the comment.

japanese: 昨日魚を食べました。
english: I ate fish yesterday.

japanese: ボールを渡して。
english: Give me the ball.

japanese: 早く家に帰って来なさい。
english: Hurry home.

japanese: 自分のペースでやりなさい。
english: Pace yourself.

japanese: 今すぐこれを読んで。
english: Read this now.

japanese: 彼を釈放して。
english: Release him.

japanese: もう一度言って。
english: Say that again.

japanese: ごみを外に出して。
english: Take the garbage out.

japanese: ゴミ出しといて。
english: Take the garbage out.

japanese: ここで待って。
english: Wait here.

japanese: ここで待ってて。
english: Wait here.

japanese: 置いていかないで。
english: Don't leave me.
